sentences.en: B: I had my reasons. Don't be so uptight.
sentences.cn: 乙: 我有我的原因, 别这么紧张.

sentences.en: But luckily my new boss isn't uptight at all.
sentences.cn: 但幸运的是我的新老板不是那样的人.

sentences.en: Coffee bars will only work in Santiago, because Chileans are so uptight.
sentences.cn: 咖啡馆只有在圣地亚哥才能经营, 因为这里太保守了.

sentences.en: I get a bit uptight these days. Hormones, I suppose.
sentences.cn: 这些天我有点焦躁。我看是荷尔蒙在作怪。

sentences.en: I tend to get very uptight during a match.
sentences.cn: 比赛时我总会紧张得不行。

sentences.en: Penny never got uptight about exams.
sentences.cn: 彭尼从未对考试感到紧张。

sentences.en: Relax! You're getting too uptight about it.
sentences.cn: 轻松点儿！你对这事太紧张了。

sentences.en: She was uptight about the interview.
There's no use you getting uptight about me, Mr. Elmore.
sentences.cn: 我说艾慕尔先生,你跟我发脾气没用.

sentences.en: Tonight he is manic, wired and uptight.
sentences.cn: 今晚，他躁动不安，紧张兮兮的。

sentences.en: Try being low - key and open rather than uptight and defensive.
sentences.cn: 试着低调一点,开放一点,而不是紧张和保守.

sentences.en: Try to laugh at it instead of getting uptight.
sentences.cn: 试着一笑了之,不要紧张.

sentences.en: Why are you so uptight about getting that job?
sentences.cn: 你干嘛这样急着要得到那份工作 呢 ?

sentences.en: Why is everyone so uptight about answering a few questions?
sentences.cn: 为什么每个人回答这些问题都这样激动呢?

sentences.en: You can shove your uptight morals up your ass.
sentences.cn: 把你那可怜的道德挤到屁股上去吧!

sentences.en: You really are uptight ! We're at a dance club , and you're still trying to learn English!

words.tran_cn: 紧张的；拮据的；心情焦躁的；易怒的

trans.tran_cn: <口>紧张的，愤怒的，经济状况不佳的，<美>极端保守的
trans.tran_en: Someone who is uptight is tense, nervous, or annoyed about something and so is difficult to be with
